intro: Astragalus subcaulescens, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, erect stems that are often branched. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, with oval to lance-shaped leaflets, and it has a deep taproot system adapted to drought conditions. Astragalus subcaulescens is often found in sandy soils and is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae.
